channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Debris and mud spread by hedge cutting has reduced the pavement to a dangerously narrow way for pedestrians., 21st February
item.description:
The worst of this is from opposite the main entrance to Tredington House to opposite the Farm Entrance, but continues to a lesser extent all the way to the Primary School. Could the forthcoming road closures provide an ideal time to clear up the mess?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 21st February
item.description:
pothole is starting to form this isnt an emergancy - its like a speed bump but not its like tiny stones all together breaking of the ground.

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 21st February
item.description:
Pothole getting bigger by the day day deeper than a tennis ball size of a plate. Was previously reported but getting bigger, No triage words, no damage caused.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10m from traffic lights a deep hole on nearside., 21st February

item.title: Large deep pot hole in Dark Lane adjacent to entrance to The Cottage ., 21st February
item.description:

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection, 21st February
item.description:
Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection. Two bags, one containing general litter and the other cans/plastic bottles for recycling. Next to the Innsworth Lane Sports Ground sign. The 'What 3 Words' location is ///examiner.slopes.courage The ordnance survey map reference is: 51.883919,-2.213313 Council Litter Bin Ref: 0254

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large sofas dumped in lay-by just off A40 (on the east bound side), 21st February
item.description:

item.title: Multiple Large Potholes, 21st February
item.description:
